availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Baker (Caldwell co., ky, blacksmith)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Tennessee native. Married to Matilda Ann Barry Baker in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on April 18, 1846. Father of James Baker, Betty Baker, David Baker, Fannie Baker, and Joel Baker. Blacksmith in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 38.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
